title: Album Page, "Sketch of Trophy with Elements of Battle", late 19th century
medium: Graphite on thick, off-white wove paper with deckled edges, folded and tipped into binding with fabric
markings: Watermark: left side of sheet: C inscribed in shield;  right side of sheet: six-pointed star / De More (?)
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, bottom center: very low relief; left . . . ; left center edge: bottle brown. Verso, in graphite, upper right corner of left side (as bound): 115; bottom right corner: 106.
dimensions: Sheet: 60 x 42 cm (23 5/8 x 16 9/16 in.), irregular
description: Sheet of vertical rectangle that has been folded and tipped into binding depicting a sculptural trophy with weapons seen in elevation.  The shield has the head of animal and from behind it protrudes various swords, arrows, maces, and halberds.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Sketch of Trophy with Elements of Battle", late 19th century.Graphite on thick, off-white wove paper with deckled edges, folded and tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-280.
